20101228015126.000|20101228015128.000|TR0|whether they are worthy of health care.  
20101228015128.000|20101228015130.000|TR0|Such a system is downright evil."
20101228015130.000|20101228015131.000|TR0|
20101228015131.000|20101228015133.000|TR0|In the controversy that followed, the idea 
20101228015133.000|20101228015135.000|TR0|of Medicare supported end-of-life 
20101228015135.000|20101228015137.000|TR0|counseling was dropped from the 
20101228015137.000|20101228015139.000|TR0|legislation.
20101228015139.000|20101228015141.000|TR0|
20101228015141.000|20101228015143.000|TR0|PARKER:  And now, it's back.  Starting

20101228015145.000|20101228015147.000|TR0|the Obama administration are going to 
20101228015147.000|20101228015148.000|TR0|reimburse doctors for advising patients on 
20101228015148.000|20101228015150.000|TR0|end-of-life care.  Why would the 
20101228015150.000|20101228015152.000|TR0|administration resurrect death panels?  
20101228015152.000|20101228015154.000|TR0|Joining us are two health care experts, 
20101228015154.000|20101228015156.000|TR0|Professor Kenneth Thorpe, head of the 
20101228015156.000|20101228015158.000|TR0|Department of Health Policy at Emory

20101228015211.000|20101228015213.000|TR0|FORMER DOCTOR:  Thank you.

20101228015217.000|20101228015219.000|TR0|UNIVERSITY:  Thank you.     SPITZER:  All 
20101228015219.000|20101228015220.000|TR0|right.  First, Professor Thorpe, let me 
20101228015220.000|20101228015222.000|TR0|ask you this question.  Does what the 
20101228015222.000|20101228015224.000|TR0|president is going to do through 
20101228015224.000|20101228015226.000|TR0|regulation in terms of end-of-life

20101228015228.000|20101228015230.000|TR0|panels?  Can you just shed light on what 
20101228015230.000|20101228015232.000|TR0|has become an unfortunate, my view, a 
20101228015232.000|20101228015234.000|TR0|terribly unfortunate phrase to capture a 
20101228015234.000|20101228015236.000|TR0|critically important issue?
20101228015236.000|20101228015237.000|TR0|
20101228015237.000|20101228015239.000|TR0|THORPE:  Well, I agree it is incredibly 
20101228015239.000|20101228015241.000|TR0|unfortunate.  Became the poster child I 
20101228015241.000|20101228015243.000|TR0|think of the opposition's attempts to kill 
20101228015243.000|20101228015245.000|TR0|the health care bill.
20101228015245.000|20101228015247.000|TR0|
20101228015247.000|20101228015249.000|TR0|All we're talking about here is providing 
20101228015249.000|20101228015251.000|TR0|funding for physicians to have a 
20101228015251.000|20101228015253.000|TR0|discussion with their patients on options 
20101228015253.000|20101228015254.000|TR0|at the end of life.  It's empowering 
20101228015254.000|20101228015256.000|TR0|patients.  It's giving patients 
20101228015256.000|20101228015258.000|TR0|information about how they may proceed if 
20101228015258.000|20101228015300.000|TR0|they have a terminal illness, about how 
20101228015300.000|20101228015302.000|TR0|aggressive they want to be, what impact, 
20101228015302.000|20101228015304.000|TR0|different treatment options may have on 
20101228015304.000|20101228015306.000|TR0|longevity, the quality of their life, 
20101228015306.000|20101228015308.000|TR0|their health care prospects.  It's 
20101228015308.000|20101228015309.000|TR0|something that any patient in any family 
20101228015309.000|20101228015311.000|TR0|would want to have information about.
20101228015311.000|20101228015313.000|TR0|
20101228015313.000|20101228015315.000|TR0|PARKER:  Doctor Scheiner, don't you just 
20101228015315.000|20101228015317.000|TR0|have this conversation with your patients 
20101228015317.000|20101228015319.000|TR0|anyway?
20101228015319.000|20101228015321.000|TR0|
20101228015321.000|20101228015323.000|TR0|SCHEINER:  Yes, absolutely.  I think it's 
20101228015323.000|20101228015325.000|TR0|like paying me to listen to a patient's 
20101228015325.000|20101228015326.000|TR0|heart and lungs.  I think should be part 
20101228015326.000|20101228015328.000|TR0|of the normal examination.  I think it's 
20101228015328.000|20101228015330.000|TR0|good it was added because I think it will 
20101228015330.000|20101228015332.000|TR0|bring to the fore that whole issue.  I 
20101228015332.000|20101228015334.000|TR0|think doctors too often neglect doing this 
20101228015334.000|20101228015336.000|TR0|kind of thing.
20101228015336.000|20101228015338.000|TR0|
20101228015338.000|20101228015340.000|TR0|Last week, I was involved in two personal 
20101228015340.000|20101228015342.000|TR0|end-of-life situations. One was a woman, 
20101228015342.000|20101228015343.000|TR0|72 years old who, had obvious end-stage 
20101228015343.000|20101228015345.000|TR0|lung cancer. And the oncologists were 
20101228015345.000|20101228015347.000|TR0|already to start more PET scans and more 
20101228015347.000|20101228015349.000|TR0|CT scans and chemotherapy.  And the 
20101228015349.000|20101228015351.000|TR0|patient and her sister and I sat down.  We 
20101228015351.000|20101228015353.000|TR0|talked about it.  We decided hospice care 
20101228015353.000|20101228015355.000|TR0|was the best way to go.  We would have 
20101228015355.000|20101228015357.000|TR0|tortured this poor woman to weigh 80 
20101228015357.000|20101228015359.000|TR0|pounds.
20101228015359.000|20101228015400.000|TR0|
20101228015400.000|20101228015402.000|TR0|Death panel is pure demagoguery.  This is 
20101228015402.000|20101228015404.000|TR0|a part of taking care of a patient.  We 
20101228015404.000|20101228015406.000|TR0|should be talking about this.  I signed my 
20101228015406.000|20101228015408.000|TR0|advance directives for my own self when I 
20101228015408.000|20101228015410.000|TR0|was in my early 50s.  I think we should 
20101228015410.000|20101228015412.000|TR0|probably be talking about this to people

20101228015414.000|20101228015415.000|TR0|arrive, arise, where they might be in an

20101228015436.000|20101228015438.000|TR0|here. What we are talking about is, and 
20101228015438.000|20101228015440.000|TR0|you use the phrase advance directives that 
20101228015440.000|20101228015442.000|TR0|let the patient determine what measures

20101228015505.000|20101228015506.000|TR0|30 percent of the population has an 
20101228015506.000|20101228015508.000|TR0|advance directive.  Well, before I could 
20101228015508.000|20101228015510.000|TR0|really put together an advance directive

20101228015512.000|20101228015514.000|TR0|options would be available to me in a case
